Stratified Multivariable Negative Binomial Regression

Source: R/stratified_multi_nbin.R
stratified_multi_nbin.Rd

Performs multivariable negative binomial regression with multiple exposures on a count outcome, stratified by a specified variable. Observations with missing values in the stratifier are excluded.

Usage

stratified_multi_nbin(data, outcome, exposures, stratifier)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the variables.

outcome

A character string specifying the name of the count outcome variable.

exposures

A character vector of predictor (exposure) variables.

stratifier

A character string specifying the variable used for stratification (must be categorical).

Value

An object of class `stratified_multi_reg_nbin` with the following components:

$table

A `gtsummary::tbl_merge` object combining stratified model tables.

$models

A named list of `glm.nb` model objects per stratum.

$model_summaries

A list of tidy model summaries using `broom::tidy()`.

$reg_check

Optional regression diagnostics per stratum (e.g., overdispersion).

Accessors

Use `object$table`, `object$models`, `object$model_summaries`, or `object$reg_check` to extract components.

See also

[multi_reg_nbin()], [stratified_uni_reg_nbin()], [check_dispersion()]
